result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly Y Badgett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Any remaining costs to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 1 day Huber consecutive for non-payment.
Huber with standard release conditions commencing 11/30/2015 at 5:00 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly Y Badgett

records.addlTxt: Income Assignment Order for Unpaid Fines and Other Financial Penalties signed by Judge Ramirez on 5/17/2018.

records.addlTxt: AODA certificate filed.

Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Defendant's sponser makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  State has complied with victim rights.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed Sentence of:
7 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit -0 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 11/30/2015 @ 5:00 p.m. 
COSTS:  $253.00   Bail to be applied.  
$53.00 left due and owing to be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay; the Court orders alternate sentence of 1 days Huber consecutive.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Sentencing hearing at 11-23-2015 03:00 pm

Case called at 9:34 am. Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court revokes and forfeits bail, issues a capias, to be brought before branch 3, for the nonappearance of the defendant.  Case recalled at 9:56 am.  Defendant made her appearance.  Court vacates his prior order, bail reinstated.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Court schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury status hearing on October 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett did not appear.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the nonappearance of the defendant.  Court revokes/forfeits bail,  issues capias at $100.00 cashbail.  Case recalled.  Defendant Kimberly Badgett appeared late.  Court reinstates bail, quashes capias.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kimberly Y Badgett in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant updates address.  Defendant is scheduled to resolve her Milwaukee County matter on 7/16/15.  Defense requests further proceedings date after that date.  Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
